summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between defense attorneys Christian Everdell and Mark S. Cohen and Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York, primarily regarding the scheduling of Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing following her arrest. It details logistical coordination, including attorney access, pretrial services interviews, and submission deadlines for legal filings.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating scheduling, bail submissions, and attorney-client access with prosecutors.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on emails regarding case logistics and scheduling.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused, arrested in New Hampshire, to be arraigned in SDNY, and subject of bail discussions.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case, to whom scheduling letters and submissions are addressed.

connections.description: Co-defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating jointly on case logistics and communications with prosecutors.
Everdell is acting as defense counsel for Maxwell, seeking to arrange communication with her while she is detained.
Cohen is acting as defense counsel for Maxwell, copied on all logistical communications regarding her case.
Engaged in professional correspondence to coordinate scheduling, bail hearings, and discovery procedures for the Maxwell case.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The FBI arrested Ghislaine Maxwell in Bradford, New Hampshire. She was to be presented in the District of New Hampshire via remote proceedings.

events.title: Unsealing of Indictment
events.description: Prosecutors informed defense counsel of the arrest and attached the indictment and arrest warrant, noting they were seeking formal unsealing in SDNY.

events.title: Maxwell Arrives at MDC
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrived in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and was to be housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

events.title: Proposed Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: The parties coordinated to propose an arraignment and bail hearing for Friday, July 10, 2020, with defense bail submissions due Thursday, July 9.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI in Bradford, New Hampshire, on July 2, 2020.
Defense attorneys Christian Everdell and Mark S. Cohen were coordinating her legal defense, focusing on scheduling her arraignment and preparing a bail application.
Maxwell was transported to and housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in the Southern District of New York.
The prosecution and defense agreed to propose a Friday arraignment and bail hearing, with the defense needing until Thursday to prepare a bail submission.
The emails show procedural coordination between defense and prosecution regarding speedy trial time exclusions, pretrial services interviews, and protective orders for discovery.
